summary: chelsea have made an offer for yoshinori muto, according to fc tokyo president naoki ogane . ogane claims chelsea's interest is not connected to the £200million sponsorship deal they signed with japanese company yokohama rubber in february . the 22-year-old would be the first japanese player to represent chelsea if he moves to west london . muto has scored three goals in four games so far this season .

chelsea have made an offer for yoshinori muto, according to fc tokyo president naoki ogane . ogane claims chelsea's interest is not connected to the £200million sponsorship deal they signed with japanese company yokohama rubber in february . the 22-year-old would be the first japanese player to represent chelsea if he moves to west london . muto has scored three goals in four games so far this season .

chelsea have made an offer for yoshinori muto, according to fc tokyo president naoki ogane . ogane claims chelsea's interest is not connected to the £200million sponsorship deal they signed with japanese company yokohama rubber in february . the 22-year-old would be the first japanese player to represent chelsea if he moves to west london . muto has scored three goals in four games so far this season .
aspect: 1. Chelsea offers FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto, who has played for J-League side since 2013, and will join Chelsea's Dutch partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season.
2. Muto is the first Japanese player to represent Chelsea if he moves to west London, and he has earned 11 caps for his country, scoring once.
3. Muto has not yet decided to join the club, although he admits it's an 'honour' to receive an offer from Chelsea.
